page.title: 14MR. V. KNAPP (continued)
page.content: river from Lydney on the old Matilda. The coal was taken to a yard at the back of an old cottage which has now been knocked down, it cost 9d. per bag,people collected it in old prams and such like. A shop was next to the Methodist Chapel, behind it was a place for stray cattle. A special date he remembers is the Oldbury Fair, then it was a very big occasion, held in front of the two pubs. They had Oldbury Tart, cockles, brandy snaps and a coconut shy. He did a lot of salmon fishing, with putchers, a special basket for catching salmon, but now the Power Station is built on top of four of those places. When he was older he worked there for 10 years helping to build the reservoir. When he was young he was very religious but now he hardly ever goes to Church.
